DOCNAME: AANNEMERSBEDRIJF GEBROEDERS VAN LEEUWEN B.V. v. THE NETHERLANDS
TEXT: The applicant is a limited liability company under GPE law ( besloten vennootschap met beperkte aansprakelijkheid ) which has its registered seat in GPE . It was declared bankrupt in DATE .
It is represented before the ORG by Mr W.T.J.G. Osse , a lawyer practising in PERSON ( the GPE ) . Mr ORG is also the trustee ( curator ) in the applicant company 's bankruptcy proceedings .

On DATE the applicant company was subjected to a search of its LOC by the public authorities . They confiscated the administration of the applicant company because there was a suspicion that the applicant company had been drawing up false invoices . The applicant company ceased trading .
On DATE ORG ( Arrondissementsrechtbank ) of GPE declared the applicant company bankrupt and appointed Mr Osse as trustee in the bankruptcy proceedings .

On DATE the applicant company was notified of the closure of the preliminary judicial investigation ( gerechtelijk vooronderzoek ) . On DATE the applicant company received a notification that the prosecution would not be pursued in view of the time which had elapsed since the alleged offences had been committed .
Despite repeated requests , the administration of the applicant company was not returned to it by the public authorities until DATE .

On DATE the trustee in the bankruptcy proceedings initiated civil proceedings against the ORG claiming compensation on behalf of the applicant company for the actions of the police and justice officials . He argued that these actions had retrospectively lost all justification given that the charges had been dropped . On DATE ORG of The GPE gave judgment rejecting the ORG 's claims . The ORG lodged an appeal with ORG ( Gerechtshof ) of GPE .

On DATE ORG , in an interlocutory judgment , held that the actions of the ORG , although initially justified , had in fact lost all justification and that as a result the ORG was liable to pay damages . However , the obligation to pay damages might be mitigated , or lapse altogether , in light of circumstances which might appear from statements made by management personnel of the applicant company before the police in the criminal investigation . In order to establish whether or not this was the case , ORG requested the ORG to submit documents from the criminal investigation file .

The ORG submitted statements made to the police by the applicant company 's managing directors in which it was admitted that false invoices had been drawn up and that taxes and social security contributions had been unlawfully withheld .
